question.questionText: The motors shown at the right with the D-cell batteries will NOT run. Explain why.

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: The negative terminals of the D-cell batteries are facing each other, so there is no flow of electricity.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: The motors will not run because it goes from the positive side to the positive side it has to go from positive to negative to work.
It will not work because the positive is going to the positive end, the positive need to run into the negative side for it to run.
It is not put to series.
Because it is hooked up negative to negative and positive to positive.
It needs to be negative to positive.
It will not work because it is negative to negative, it has to positive to negative.
The batteries are negative to negative.
It will not run because negative and negative and positive and positive are facing the same way.
Because the wires in between the D-cells are connected to the same end.
It is go out the wrong way.
The 2 negative ends of the D-cells are facing each other and the electricity cannot get out.
Both of the motors are hooked up to the positive wire, in order for it to work one has to be hooked to a positive and the other has to be hooked up to a negative.
They will not run because the electricity is going in a circle. And the electricity would be run in and out.
The motors at the right will not run because the electricity flows out of the negative side and they have the D-cells trying to make electricity flow out the positive side.
One battery is the wrong way.
It will not run because there is not enough D-cells to make both of them work.
Because a negative and a negative will not work.
The motor shall not run because electricity flows out of the negative side of the battery.
The motors will not run because the D-cells has to be switched around.
They will not run because the electricity gets stopped when it goes through the D-cells.
The motors shown at the right will not run because 2 negatives are connected.
The wires are not supposed to be connected like that.
Because you need more wires.
Because the motors do not have a minus side. They both have a positive side.
The motor at the right will not run because each one does not have a positive and a negative.
Because positive is facing it.
Maybe the left wire went out of energy so maybe the right one went out of energy so both of them are out.
If you look very closely the positive to positive and negative to negative. Positive and positive do not go together.
It will not work because it is dead battery.
Because one has the most power than the other one.
Because one D-cell has to be between the motors.
The motor will not run because it is in an open circuit.
The wires are at the negative end of the battery or D-cell so the motor is not going to run because the wire is at the negative end.
The D-cell is hooked up to the negative end and the other negative end and it cannot get any energy.
The negative end is pointing at the negative end so no electricity can flow to the motors.
The negative end are sharing so the D-cell is getting all the power.
Because electricity does not flow from positive to positive they flow from negative to positive.
The electricity is flowing from a positive to a positive end, when the negative should give the electricity to the motor and back to a positive end.
